meanings.definition: A small, round, soft-bodied invertebrate animal.
meanings.sent1: The children found colorful nides under the rock.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the behavior of nides in their natural habitat.
meanings.sent3: The nides had a party in the garden last night.
meanings.sent4: The field was teeming with nides, like a bustling city.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, the nides glowed softly in the twilight.

meanings.definition: To remove or get rid of something unwanted.
meanings.sent1: Please nides the old furniture from the attic.
meanings.sent2: She decided to nides all the clutter in her room.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to nides the rabbit from the hat but failed comically.
meanings.sent4: He wished he could nides his worries as easily as taking out the trash.
meanings.sent5: With determination, she began to nides the negative thoughts from her mind.

meanings.definition: A small, round, soft-bodied invertebrate animal.
meanings.sent1: The nides crawled slowly across the forest floor.
meanings.sent2: In the pond, tiny nides swam gracefully among the plants.
meanings.sent3: The nides organized a race to see who was the fastest.
meanings.sent4: The garden was a kingdom of nides, each with its own role to play.
meanings.sent5: Children giggled with delight as they observed the nides up close.
